Entry.1:
Thursday.

Escort. to Amman on bomb raid Pilot Capt Addison In air 3 hours 15 min. Machines bombed wrong place and rotten bombing
Entry.2:
Recco. 

Pilot Lt Austin in B.F. In air 2 hours. Saw 5 Hun scouts but they would not take us on and owing to strong adverse wind they we did not engage.
Entry.3: My double guns are completed except for sights
Entry.4:
Escort to Tul Keram in a B.F. Pilot Capt Addison. returned on account of clouds. In air 1 hour Started again R.E.8 dud engine returned again we can through telephone lines & but do a & land safely. in air 20 min.

Did Tul Keram recco in B.F. pilot . In air 2 hours 15 min a good recco though cloudy.
Entry.5:
Went up with Cameron in a RE8 and tested my double . Fired well- very pleased with .

In air 20 min
Entry.6:
Recco. Tul Keram B.F. Pilot Lt. Brown In air 2 hours 10 min

A good recco uneventfull though 2 Huns followed us. Took my double guns out for first time went well.

Oliver Lee goes on leave.
Entry.7:
Escort to Photos in B.F. Pilot Capt Addison- Height 14 to 1500 ft.

Saw 2 Huns but could not leave photo. machines to have a wanted to try my double guns.
Entry.8:
Tul Keram- Nablus recco in a B.F. Pilot Capt. Addison in air 2 hours

a good trip we prayed to meet Huns but saw none. I have my double guns in full working order.

Flying- Actual jobs 148h.15m. flights etc. 6h 15m
Entry.9: Lts. Pool & Fred have dud engine over Tul Keram and land in enemy lines (in a BF.) They machine and are taken prisoner.
Entry.10: to Jericho recco in a BF. pilot Capt Addison. In air 2 hours. Had to land as gun was not firing got away 2nd time pressure very bad but it and did escort a good trip and uneventfull, have met no Huns since I got double guns.
Entry.11:
A lovely spell of warm sunny weather but the nights are chilly.

Saw mosaic uncovered near camp.
Entry.12: Went down to Dier & had a tooth out.
Entry.13:
Escort to Photographic machines In air 3 hours 27 min. Height 14,000 to 15,500 ft.

Very cold up so high. An uneventfull trip

Pilot Capt Addison in a B.F.
Entry.14:
Feel off colour today.

The B.F. gives me a thick head for ½ day after a trip.

Lovely weather still continues

26 Vendredi. Saturday.

Escort to photos.

Pilot Capt Addison in B.F. In air 1 hour 20 min. Returned owing to thick clouds.

My leave is through for the 1st Feb.
Entry.15:
Oliver Lee returns from leave

a wet day.

28 Dimanche.

Wet and stormy.

Recco with Addy in .B.F. take off in high wind crash both unhurt. Machine turns right over on her back.

29 Lundi.

Stormy.

30 Mardi.

A better day but cloudy.

31 Mercredi.

Escort to Photos. in B.F. pilot Capt. Addison

in air 1 hour returned owing to engine trouble.

Leave for Cairo on leave tonight.

21 Mercredi.

Leave granted to the Sqdn. two clear days from canal to canal.

Played 13 Sqdn 3rd Reg football and beat them 4 goals to 10 points.

Revisited Joe Rodnell’s grave

Submitted report vegetables supplied to Sqdn.

22 Jeudi.

Photos taken of old C Sqdn.

23 Vendredi.

O’Bryon receives his 

Drew to Mk. VI plates

24 Samedi.

Fred & O’Brion leave for school.

25 Dimanche.

Played A Sqdn. football we were beaten.
Entry.16:
Wrote H. Reed.

letter from Home.
Entry.18:
Clem Sqdn

Played F. Amb. football & beat them
Entry.19:
Lent Fred £15.

No Church Parade today

General inspection at 10A.M.

Payed £1
Entry.20: Exercise in morning. afternoon gun drill.
Entry.21:
Paddock for horses made. Fired 500 rounds gun result poor.

Explanation required, failing to report while in Cairo.
Entry.23: Rained most of the day. Played F.A. in afternoon & beat them.
Entry.24:
Orderly Officer

Tent inspection at 8.45. Louse killing parade to the disinfectant train at Bir-el-Abd. All leave stopped.

Sgt-Major up has a fall from his horse enters hospital. takes over.

A rough day.
Entry.26:
Went out with Quigley, Craddock & Robinson. shifted Joe Rodnell’s grave about 20 yards.

Windy day

Payed out
Entry.27: Went round old battle field with Davis
Entry.28:
Went out to Joe Rodnell’s grave took 

Tents in afternoon

we move in morning.
Entry.29:
Moved off at 10 A.M.

Orderly Officer, camp left clean buried feed only. Arrived 4 PM.
Entry.30:
Moved off at 8.30 AM arrived at 

Fred joins us in afternoon 114
Entry.32:
Orderly Officer.

Received new Vickers gun

Swimm before breakfast

Swam horses.
Entry.35:
Church parade 0900

Holy Communion after service

Developed films in tank.
Entry.36:
Printed photos.

5 & 6 Sections played 1 to 4 sect. & F. A. we won

Bombardment up coast all day
Entry.38:
Orderly Officer

Very bad water supply at the trough.

Rifle inspection.

Orders that picquet has to be inspected twice every night.

First saw tanks through . Letters from Home
Entry.39:
Played 1st Reg. football & beat them.

No news Gaza operations
Entry.40:
News from Gaza not very good.

Parcell from Home
Entry.41:
Much discussion over Big races.

Had good swimm splendid 

Played C Sqdn.
Entry.42:
Reg football beat them by 2 points

Pater Gordon preaches for last time.
Entry.43: Exercise horses with packs up in afternoon
Entry.44:
Went to ordinance in morning

afternoon stoppages
Entry.45:
Orderly Officer.

Brig Races.

El-ARish cup- Boom.

N.C.O.s race- no 4 Sect.

Fred has had fall in Officers’ race
Entry.46:
Left El-Arish- arrived Sheik Zowaid in evening.

we bought some whiskey.
Entry.47:
Arrived Khan-Yhunis in evening passed over lovely pasture country especially round Rafa. Rode through village of K-Y. reminded of Upper Egypt. Has been place at one time, ruins of Mosque.

The whole country is out in wild flowers, giving a lovely perfume.

The bedouins were getting in their crops of bearded wheat as we passed along
Entry.48:
Easter Sunday- reminded of old times at Home.

Camped on the sand on the edge of orchards round Khan-Yhunis
Entry.49: Attended gas lecture at Div. H.Q.
Entry.50:
Brig Sqdn saw 

Parcell from Home.
Entry.51:
gas helmets

12 Jeudi.

Took over Outpost line.

13 Vendredi.

Came in from outpost had a comfortable night in reserve. In morning rode round outpost with Clem.

Through glasses saw the red roofs & mud huts of Gaza

Our planes bombed heavily about 5 miles out

14 Samedi.

Gas lecture at B.H.Q.

In afternoon went swimming received cake, books & papers from Home.

15 Dimanche.

Saw Audie Cunningham.

16 Lundi.

Big stunt on tonight, preparations going on. All looking forward to a good go. The first time have had section into action, anxious to have a go with them Section will do well.

2 Mercredi.

Received 2nd 

16 Mercredi.

Take over outpost lines from Bill O’Brion.

17 Jeudi.

Our line taken over by 74th Div.

18 Vendredi.

Not feeling well for last week will wear off.

Went over to see Bob at 2nd F.A. he had not arrived

20 Dimanche.

Stood to arms 3.30A.M. rifle inspection, 

21 Lundi.

1.15 P.M. Set out for raid.

watered in at Bir-el-

Blew up railway South of Beersheba early in 22nd inst. passed through Khalassa an interesting ruined city.

Distance travelled 55 miles Country undulating sand hills & soil, patches of cultivation, grass land & scrub. Very few inhabitants met with.

Trail of smoke left behind us by burning crops & stacks. Dusty going but lovely day. No opposition

24 Jeudi.

Stand to arms 3.30.

25 Vendredi.

Stand to arms 3000

26 Samedi.

Gas demonstration.

New pay books issued.

27 Dimanche.

Stand to arms 3 A.M.

Church parade 8.30

28 Lundi.

Left Shellal & arrived -el-Kebir

31 Jeudi.

Spent day with Bob on Khan Yhunis beach.

3 Dimanche.

Visited R.F.C. at Rafa. Had first flight in aeroplane enjoyed it immensely.

Interviewed Capt Williams & Major Routledge.

Saw E. & Bob.

4 Lundi.

Sent letter Capt. Williams

Saw Gen. Cox will recco. strongly.

Submitted application to transfer.

1st cons. beer.

5 Mardi.

Visited Major Routledge 

6 Mercredi.

Message dropped on us by .

Saw Major Williams at Rafa.

Interviewed Gen. Cox.

7 Jeudi.

Put in 2nd application for transfer.

 drill.

8 Vendredi.

Aust. mail.

9 Samedi.

Field day very hot work.

10 Dimanche.

Church parade.

11 Lundi.

Clean up.
Entry.52:
Clean up.

2nd cons. beer.

13 Mercredi.

Section steel work in Sqdn.

awfull having to do it

14 Jeudi.

All steel work clean.

16 Samedi.

Saw Capt. Williams at Rafa good hope of transfer

17 Dimanche.

Church in evening.

Saw Bob at Aboron-el-Kebir

18 Lundi.

Moved down to the beach

a great camp.

19 Mardi.

Swimm before breakfast

clean up.

20 Mercredi.

Clean up.

3rd beer issue.

23 Samedi.

Arrived Cairo in afternoon.

25 Lundi.

Summary trial Duncan.

3 Mardi.

Morning. Duncan court-martialed.

received 1 year (hard labour?) for desertion- a bad type.

4 Mercredi.

Left Cairo for Palestine

5 Jeudi.

Arrived at camp near Fara.

Rode to F.C. at 

6 Vendredi.

Attached to 67th Sqdn R.F.C. (Aust). Reported to 

 & self leave for Cairo.

7 Samedi.

Arrived at No 3 School of Aeronautics, attended class in afternoon.

Met & Lee also Finlay

8 Dimanche.

Went to Citadel bought camp bed there.

9 Lundi.

Stew

10 Mardi.

Passed out in 

Stew

11 Mercredi.

Stew

12 Jeudi.

Stew.
Entry.53:
Papers from home.

14 Samedi.

Letters from home.

& book of Psalms.

16 Lundi.

Examination. did well an easy paper.

18 Mercredi.

Left No 3 S.M.A. for 7 days leave in Alexandria.

Arrived Hotel Villa Margherita

Looked in at the Casino in afternoon.

19 Jeudi.

10.30 A.M. Bathing at Sandy Bay beach.

20 Vendredi.

Bathing.

21 Samedi.

Bathing.

21 Dimanche.

Bathing

Dinner at 

Finlay, , Self.

Mrs Arnold, Miss 

Miss Gordon-Smith.

23 Lundi.

Bathing.

Dinner at Savoy.

, Self Miss Miss G.-Smith.

24 Mardi.

Yachting trip out to island of 

a splendid day swimming & sailing. Life is worth living in the army after all. Only wish Mater had been there & the girls.

25 Mercredi.

Leave Villa Margherita for Aboukir School of Aerial Gunnery.

The best holiday we have had in Egypt a splendid time.

Report at S.A.G. Aboukir

26 Jeudi.

Instruction

Lewis gun.

27 Vendredi.

Instruction Lewis gun.

Ring sights, camera gun

Letters from Home.

28 Samedi.

Aerial gunnery .

Firing targets on ground.

" on sea.

Aiming at planes while flying.

Absolute bliss & will be till novelty wears off.

29 Dimanche.

 & Self.

Dinner at San Casino with Miss G-Smith & Miss Sheriffs.

30 Lundi.

Aerial gunnery.

31 Mardi.

Aerial gunnery

Passed out in Lewis Gun.

6 days at Aboukir.

Afternoon left for Cairo.

Miss G-S & Miss S. saw us off at Sidi Gaber.

Arrived Continental Hotel Cairo.

1 Mercredi.

Much done.

The Continental is full of Australian nurses, not a very good sample, either

2 Jeudi.

Left Cairo for Palestine 11 A.M.

3 Vendredi.

Arrived Belir 7.30A.M.

Reported to 67th Sqdn. A.F.C.

Cable from Mother

Papers from England.

4 Samedi.

In the air 1 hour 25 min.

 enemy’s line escort to bombing machines. Hun has a go at us, no decisive results. Fired a drum at 200 range. Great fun absolutely enjoyed it. Excited before going up but as soon as we got into the air as as anything & ready for anything.

5 Dimanche.

Caught very bad cold & head ache- a real beauty.

6 Lundi.

Felt pretty rotten today.

Nothing doing.

7 Mardi.

Escort to Recco. Beersheba, in air 2 hours 40 minutes.

Feel pretty right again today.

8 Mercredi.

Letters from Home

Date 27th May.

Nothing doing.

9 Jeudi.

Nothing doing, had a lovely swimm.

Wrote, Mother Mrs G-Smith Mrs 

10 Vendredi.

Escort to recco- Tactical Strategical 

In air 2 hrs 10 minutes, well archied, fragment through plane

Orderly Officer

11 Samedi.

Nothing doing, put in the day eating figs & had a great swimm.

12 Dimanche.

Northern Heriera in Air 1 hour 45 min. cloudy morning, very tame trip.

Afternoon played 3rd Brig. cricket. They beat us. RFC 18, self 3, 3rd Brig 49.

13 Lundi.

Saw Les Lowrie.

Had a splendid swimm.
Entry.54:
Recco. over Beersheba at 5 A.M. in air 2 hours 40 min

Cloudy morning, a few archies at us wild firing.

Saw L.H. coming back from stunt.

15 Mercredi.

Swimm in afternoon.

16 Jeudi.

Tactical recco, a quiete trip observation good. First recco.

In air 1 hour 10 minutes

17 Vendredi.

Swimm in afternoon.

De Havilland crashed, pilot killed, this is the 3rd pilot killed through accident since arriving up here.

18 Samedi.

Escort Beersheba, dud machine, came back to Aerodrome after climbing in vain for 25 minutes.

Lewis jammed, burned up register, series of no 2 º

19 Dimanche.

Escort to N. Heriera in air- 2 hours 10 minutes

Threw out pamphlets a quiete trip.

20 Lundi.

Tactical recco, in air 1 hour 10 minutes a quiete trip.

21 Mardi.

Crashed on Aerodrome. Pilot stalled machine, fell from 50ft. crawled out of wreckage unhurt.

-fly Pilot Spragg. fever temperature of 103.5

22 Mercredi.

Clearing station Belir.

" " El-Arish.

23 Jeudi.

Clearing station .

25 Samedi.

Arrived 14th A.G.H. Cairo.

26 Dimanche.

Feeling well again but weak.

1 Samedi.

Arrived No 10 Convalescent Home Alex. A fine place.

2 Dimanche.

Played tennis overdid it. nerves are very bad after any exertion

7 Vendredi.

1st to 9th. Golf, tennis & swimming, had a really good quiete time.

8 Samedi.

, last 200 ft.

9 Dimanche.

Left for Belir.

10 Lundi.

Arrived Belir Aerodrome.

Tactical- In air 1 hour.

11 Mardi.

Tactical morning-

In air 55 min-

Swimm.

12 Mercredi.

Swimm in afternoon.

13 Jeudi.

Escort to B e Northern Heriera- In air 2 hours

Pamphletts stuck in tail plane.

First time have had wind up in plane,- pilot Spragg

- indecipherable.- 

15 Samedi.

First crash evidently shook confidence slightly. Every time I go up I get more confidence back again.

16 Dimanche.

Recco. Northern Heriera. A good recco & good report.

 Wing Staff Capt.- V.G.

In air 2 hours 10 minutes

17 Lundi.

Shifted over to new Aerodrome at 

Arrived in a sheet of dust a damnable place after our late home.

Flew over. In air 15 minutes.

18 Mardi.

A sheet of dust over camp & aerodrome. How the L.H. exist at all beats me.

19 Mercredi.

Orderly Officer-

A lovely morning quite nippy reminds me of a Tas. morning.

20 Jeudi.

Tactical Recco. at 6.15 A.M

Landed at Belir Aerod.

In Air 1 hour 25 min.

A trip & splendid observation.

 at mess & pictures. Bob came to tea.

23 Dimanche.

Northern Heriera.

In air 2 hours 10 min.

Cricket after afternoon tea.

First started run round aerodrome every evening before dinner.

25 Mardi.

Escort to Resm Area

Recco- In air 2 hours min.

Good trip, a few archies but close.

26 Mercredi.

Nothing doing.

 all very comfortable now.

29 Samedi.

Played 7th Reg. football Aust rules.- beat them 1 goal 7 to 1 goal 2. a good game.

30 Dimanche.

Scratch game rugby

no flying today.

1 Lundi.

Did recco to Beersheba

in air 2 hours 40 min

good recco. very cloudy till over Beersheba.

Lee & self had dinner down at the M.G. Sqdn. had a good time

good dinner. Rode my old enjoyed the ride on the old 

2 Mardi.

Played Camels cricket we won by 1 run 32 & 31 were scores.

I made 0 & for 2 runs bowled 4 overs.

Feeling absolutely fit again.

5 Vendredi.

2 letters from Home.

6 Samedi.

Reccco N Heriera.

in air 2 ½ hours.

good recco. very clear

saw Dead Sea quite plainly.

7 Dimanche.

Played Div. Hd. Q. cricket they won. by 68 runs to 27.

8 Lundi.

Bristol fighters brought down Albatros Scout, machine & pilot unhurt, bullet through radiator & petrol tank.

Pilot comes into the not a bad sort for a Hun.

Played rugby in afternoon.

11 Jeudi.

Recco. to Beersheba

In air 2 hours 20 min

a good recco.

13 Samedi.

Played Camels football

we won by 24 points, a good game.

Bob comes over for 

14 Dimanche.

Church Parade in morning, it was enjoyed.

Played 7th Regt cricket they won 80 to 45.
Entry.56:
Regt cricket they won by 88 runs to 27.

Steel & Williams in a B.F. brings down another Hun scout a beautifull scrap.

Gen Chetwoode comes to dinner.
Entry.57:
Recco- Resm.

In air 2 hours 20 min
Entry.59: Played a team from D.H.Q. cricket they won.
Entry.61:
Tactical recco.- In air 1 hour 10 minutes.

a good recco.
Entry.62:
letter from Home.

General Chevaul & staff came to dinner, band plays outside mess & pictures afterwards. Port flowing freely.
Entry.63:
Received wing together with & ,.

very pleased to get it- Am now qualified flying officer.

Fred joins Sqdn with 5 other new observers.

Recco- Resm area

in air 2 hours 25 min a good clear recco. few archies

received 7 letters- the lost mail.
Entry.64: Much aerial activity to the big stunt.
Entry.65:
Flew in R.E. 8 with Capt. Addison (a Tasmanian)

a good trip- stunts. Aim to be Capt. Addisons observer.

In air 20 min.

Preparations for the big stunt, we will have a time. Am certain to come through alright.
Entry.66:
In air 2 hours.

Recco- Resm Area & along Turkish lines for dist. of 10 miles behind- Recco. done with Capt. Addison in R.E.8. they are machines after 

would like to meet a Hun- good machine good pilot. Big stunt starts tomorrow & we have important work- quite anxious for tomorrow.
Entry.67:
Pilot Capt. Addison.

General recco- In air 2 hours 45 min. Recco right along behind Turk line saw Hun but no scrap. Came down to 2000 ft. over Rushdi & Hawaha systems, machine transport. Gave very important report in. 

 in Mono. brings down Hun two seater.
Entry.68:
Beersheba fell yesterday. Was on very important recco. today in R.E.8 with Capt. Addison but engine was dud & had to come down. We only did 4000’ in 45 min

In air- 50 min.
Entry.69: Was in recco. in a B E 2 E but recco. was put off.
Entry.70:
On Recco with Capt. Addison but engine dud again, tried another machine but worse- Came down.

In air 55 min.
Entry.71:
Recco. Mattheson reported. Saw very important work & movement. gave it to 7 on next recco.

Pilot Capt.Addison.

In air 2 hours 45 min.

 & run right through tents (in between)
Entry.72: Strategital Recco. Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 1 hour 55 min. forced landing at Saba. Spent the night at Saba railway station with 113th Sqdn Hd. Q. looked over Saba. A well laid out place almost surrounded by hills. Had luck to land machine all O.K. as the country is very rough.
Entry.73: Before breakfast went out to machine & got her off by doing a switchback up & down hills & dodging shell holes by a miricle. Engine again & just landed in Saba aerodrome flew home in 4312. In air 45 min.
Entry.74: Recco- Strategical- Pilot Lt Morgan In air 2 hours 50 min. Did long recco at 5000 over the hills to N of Saba & round to Huj. Turks left in full retreat.
Entry.75:
Escort Bomb raid & bombing. bombed Hun aerodrome at Arak-el-Menshiyeh. Over 20 machines in raid, did good work. Divet bits on hangars & railway.

Turks in full retreat- Gaza has fallen. Pilot Capt. Addison

In air 1 hour 55 min.
Entry.76:
On bomb raid in R.E. with Capt. Addison In air 15 min. at 300ft engine gave out large cloud of smoke and partially seized.

Turks still with our troops in
Entry.77: On bomb raid to Junction Station with Lt A Fraser in R.E. In air 2 hours 15 min bombed R.S. with good results My 4 bombs were on tents & shelters & close to large Fired 100 rounds into troops scattered and railway buildings- great sport. Saw Jaffa and Ramleh.
Entry.78:
Very dusty & windy day.

very little flying.
Entry.79:
Recco. to Ramleh & Jaffa. Pilot Capt Addison

very bad day- large rain clouds run into

In air 2 hours 15 min

Engine went badly nearly had to land in Turkish lines.
Entry.80:
Recco with Capt Addison

In air 3 hours.

Our troops attacking

a grand sight from the air

very important recco.
Entry.81:
Our troops take Junction Station.

5 Hun machines burnt on Arak-el- aerodrome result of our bombing there they were damaged & were not able to be removed in time.
Entry.82:
Ramleh taken.

Another Hun brought down by a B.F.
Entry.83: Recco . Jaffa taken today Pilot Capt. Addison escort to Sutherland. Round to N of Jaffa- In air 2 hours 45 min a very bad heavy rain clouds overhead – Turks have cleared out- Suthy puts in false report & consequently holds up whole of British Army.
Entry.84: Recco. to Tul Keram Pilot Capt. Addison- in air 3 hours 30 min. A cloudy morning- rained slightly. A good recco, Turks are in force at Tul-Keram, well archied from there, we like a cork in a bottle.
Entry.85: A rough day quite a lot of rain.
Entry.86:
Recco, Jerusalem, Bethlehem & Schechem, very interesting. Pilot Capt Addison- In air 4 hours 5 min. A rough day rained a lot during our recco, but a good trip, well archied.

 owes me £ 5 £ 2. 

Lee
Entry.87:
Very cold snap on here- quite a change. 51º Far. in my test at 6.30A.M.

(Cold for us.)
Entry.88:
Recco. Bethlehem, Jerusalem, Schechem, Samaria. In air 4 hours 5 min. Landed at Julis & gave in report there. We are attacking just N of Jerusalem, 7 wks Jerusalem.

A good trip important recco, never meet any Huns now but am on the look out for them.
Entry.89:
Recco. North Tul Keram Pilot Lt. Fraser. In air 3 hours 5 min. Landed at Julis & gave in report. Started at 7AM arrived back at 1.30PM. A very long & tiring trip

2425 Samedi. 

Recco. Tul Keram. Pilot Lt. L. Patts In air 3 hours 20 min. Saw 3 Huns but they did not attack seriousely.
Entry.90:
Recco,- Tul Keram Pilot Capt. Addison In air 2 hours 35 owing to thick cloud banks recco was not done.

Pilot Lt C Brown did same recco. later. in air 3 hours 15 min. Good recco. saw Hun, archied, rifle fire & field gun fire. landed in moonlight. A good trip quite enjoyed it.
Entry.91: Nothing doing. Tested machine gun- double drums unreliable
Entry.92:
Recco- Tul Keram- Pilot Capt Addison.

B.F. left us over Ludd

recco. not completed.

In air 3 hours 50 min
Entry.93: Recco- Tul Keram. In air 4 hours 35 min. A good recco. important in area.
Entry.94:
Shifted up to “Julis" from old Aerodrome at Shiek Nuran. In air 40 min.

Orderly Officer.
Entry.95: A day of digging in our tent and fixing things up.
Entry.96:
Heavy rain, much mud about

no flying.
Entry.97: Much rain last night and today no flying, impossible to take off aerodrome owing to mud
Entry.98:
Jerusalem falls

Much rain in monring & heavy cloud banks,

In afternoon was to machine gun troops from Jerusalem Pilot Lt Brown. In air 20 min Air speed not showing and engine not too good. Very dissapointed, but if we had gone would have been caught in heavy storm.
Entry.99:
Recco. Capt. Addison In air 3 hours 55 min. Made recco. of Jericho, & up to the Jordan, also Schechem, and Samaria. A good trip and a good report.

The mountains of Lebanon are capped with snow
Entry.100:
Recco. Tul Keram In air 2 hours 55 min. Took photos. of blown up bridges, and got badly archied in doing the job. Two pieces through machine.

Feeling awfully well lately, never felt better, nerves are better than ever, honestly enjoy being archied, but the pilots don’t. Cold spell quite hard to keep warm.
Entry.101:
Moved over to new aerodrome 1 mile away old drome tis boggy in wet we to get off the ground.

In air 5 min. Pilot Capt Addison.
Entry.103:
Drummond brings down 1 Hun.

In air 20 min. Flew low over Ashkalon a place of many ruins. very interesting.
Entry.104:
Recco. Tul Keram. A good trip. Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 2 hours 45 min.

Very cold up high, reached 11 000 ft.
Entry.106:
Recco. Nablus.

Pilot. Capt. Addison.

In air 2 hours 30 min.

Our B.F. escort forces a Hun to land at Nablus.
Entry.108: In orders.- my transfer is through to this unit. Dating from
Entry.111:
Turks again in retreat on our left flank.

Machine Gunnery- Pilot. Capt Addison. Fired 300 rounds at very good targets mostly R.S. & transport. them up some.

In air- 2 hours

Our engine was awfull nearly out.
Entry.112:
Rough weather sets in.

No flying.
Entry.113:
A very rough day. No flying.

We take 111th Sqdn. mess with Verie’s lights & smoke bombs, but find mess evacuated and in a wrecked condition. 111th. Sqdn. in our take our mess without opposition. We proceed to have a glorious night of it. Officers all over the desert. Lt Mattheson is lost in the rain and wind.
Entry.114: tents blow down but not mine.
Entry.115:
Machines which were in open broke loose and smashed themselves to pieces we have 2 machines only left serviceable in our flight. A terrible calamity. My old machine is wrecked.

A glorious Xmas Dinner & a great time. All enjoyed ourselves very much.

Very rough day. No flying.

No new of Matt.

27 Jeudi.

Attend Matt’s funeral.

28 Vendredi.

On recco but descended owing to dud engine. In air 15 min.

29 Samedi.

Recco. Jericho, Dead Sea, Jordan, Nablus.

Pilot. Capt. Addison. In air 3 hours.

30 Dimanche.

We get 2 Bristol Fighters- great rejoicings

Went up with Addie,

In air 30 min, looped twice,- a grand machine.

31 Lundi.

First escort in a B.F.

Pilot Capt. Addison.

In air 2 hours 45 min.

A disgracefull recco. The archies drove our recco-machine right away. awfull!

Jan 1st. Tuesday

Orderly Officer.

No flying. very stormy.

2nd Wednesday.

Escort in B.F. to Amman

Pilot Capt Addison In air 2 hours 40 min.

3rd Thursday.

Recco. Jericho. In air 2 hours

Pilot Lt. Cameron.

Bomb raid to Jack Potts & Parkinson fail to return. 1 machine from 14th Sqdn crashes wings fold up.
Entry.116: Lts Jack Potts and Parkinson reported missing- Subsequently reported Killed and respectively. 14th Sqdn. also loose 2 men killed in a R.E.8.
